Mexico Wedding & Honeymoon Guide

Plan Your Perfect Romantic Celebration

Last updated: January 2025

Mexico is one of the world's most popular destinations for weddings and honeymoons, offering stunning beaches, colonial cities, affordable luxury, and a culture that celebrates romance. Whether you're planning an intimate elopement or a 200-guest celebration, this guide covers everything you need to know.

In This Guide

  • Best Destinations for Weddings
  • Legal Requirements
  • Wedding Venue Types
  • Budget Planning
  • Honeymoon Destinations
  • Planning Timeline
  • Guest Experience
  • Tips from Wedding Planners

Best Destinations for Weddings

{<strong>Beach Weddings:</strong></p><p><strong>Riviera Maya (Tulum, Playa del Carmen)</strong></p><ul><li>Dramatic cenotes and jungle backdrops</p><ul><li>Bohemian-chic Tulum vibes</p><ul><li>Many venues from boutique to all-inclusive</p><ul><li>Best for: Trendy couples, unique venues</p><p><strong>Los Cabos</strong></p><ul><li>Desert-meets-ocean drama</p><ul><li>Sunset over Pacific</p><ul><li>High-end resort options</p><ul><li>Best for: Luxury, photogenic backgrounds</p><p><strong>Puerto Vallarta</strong></p><ul><li>Mountains, jungle, bay</p><ul><li>Charming downtown</p><ul><li>Mix of beach and hacienda venues</p><ul><li>Best for: Traditional beauty, family-friendly</p><p><strong>Colonial Weddings:</strong></p><p><strong>San Miguel de Allende</strong></p><ul><li>Most romantic city in Mexico</p><ul><li>Historic venues, rooftop terraces</p><ul><li>Iconic Parroquia church backdrop</p><ul><li>Best for: Sophisticated elegance, art lovers</p><p><strong>Oaxaca</strong></p><ul><li>Cultural depth, incredible food</p><ul><li>Unique venues and mezcal bars</p><ul><li>Authentic Mexican experience</p><ul><li>Best for: Foodies, culture seekers}

Legal Requirements

{<strong>Getting Legally Married in Mexico:</strong></p><p><strong>Required Documents:</strong></p><ul><li>Valid passports (original + copies)</p><ul><li>Birth certificates (original + apostilled translations)</p><ul><li>Tourist permits (FMM card from arrival)</p><ul><li>Blood tests (within Mexico, varies by state)</p><ul><li>Application forms from civil registry</p><ul><li>Witnesses (2-4 depending on state)</p><p><strong>Process:</strong></p><ol><li>Submit documents to civil registry 3-5 days before</p><ol><li>Take blood tests at approved lab</p><ol><li>Civil ceremony with judge (legal portion)</p><ol><li>Religious/symbolic ceremony (optional, same or different day)</p><p><strong>Simplified Option:</strong></p><ul><li>Get legally married at home before trip</p><ul><li>Have symbolic ceremony in Mexico</p><ul><li>No legal paperwork stress</p><ul><li>Same beautiful photos and celebration</p><p><strong>By State:</strong></p><ul><li>Quintana Roo (Cancún/Tulum): Most straightforward</p><ul><li>Los Cabos: Relatively easy</p><ul><li>Jalisco (Puerto Vallarta): More complex</p><ul><li>Colonial cities: Varies, work with planner</p><p><strong>Important Notes:</strong></p><ul><li>Requirements vary by state—confirm locally</p><ul><li>Work with wedding planner or resort coordinator</p><ul><li>Start paperwork 3-6 months ahead</p><ul><li>Apostilles take time—don't wait}

Wedding Venue Types

{<strong>All-Inclusive Resort Weddings:</strong></p><ul><li>Packages include venue, catering, cake, basic decor</p><ul><li>Dedicated wedding coordinator</p><ul><li>Easy logistics for guests</p><ul><li>Pro: Convenient, predictable costs</p><ul><li>Con: Can feel generic, limited customization</p><p><strong>Boutique Hotel Weddings:</strong></p><ul><li>More intimate, personalized</p><ul><li>Unique architecture and settings</p><ul><li>Often better food</p><ul><li>Pro: Special, memorable venues</p><ul><li>Con: More coordination required</p><p><strong>Private Villa Weddings:</strong></p><ul><li>Rent entire property</p><ul><li>Complete privacy and control</p><ul><li>Custom everything</p><ul><li>Pro: Ultimate flexibility</p><ul><li>Con: Must coordinate all vendors</p><p><strong>Hacienda/Estate Weddings:</strong></p><ul><li>Historic properties, colonial architecture</p><ul><li>Dramatic settings, gardens</p><ul><li>Very photogenic</p><ul><li>Pro: Unique Mexican character</p><ul><li>Con: Often inland (no beach)</p><p><strong>Beach/Cenote Weddings:</strong></p><ul><li>Ceremony on sand or in jungle</p><ul><li>Reception at nearby venue</p><ul><li>Dramatic natural settings</p><ul><li>Pro: Unforgettable backdrops</p><ul><li>Con: Weather-dependent, permits required}

Budget Planning

{<strong>Average Costs (2025):</strong></p><p><strong>Budget-Friendly ($5,000-15,000):</strong></p><ul><li>Simple ceremony at all-inclusive</p><ul><li>20-50 guests</p><ul><li>Package inclusions</p><ul><li>Basic photography</p><p><strong>Mid-Range ($15,000-35,000):</strong></p><ul><li>Better venue or boutique hotel</p><ul><li>50-100 guests</p><ul><li>Professional photography/video</p><ul><li>Upgraded decor and flowers</p><p><strong>Luxury ($35,000-75,000):</strong></p><ul><li>Premium venue</p><ul><li>100-150 guests</p><ul><li>Top-tier vendors</p><ul><li>Welcome party and farewell brunch</p><p><strong>Ultra-Luxury ($75,000+):</strong></p><ul><li>Exclusive venue buyout</p><ul><li>Fly in vendors</p><ul><li>Multi-day celebrations</p><ul><li>No expense spared</p><p><strong>What's Often Extra:</strong></p><ul><li>Photographer/videographer</p><ul><li>Flowers and decor beyond package</p><ul><li>Hair and makeup</p><ul><li>Entertainment</p><ul><li>Transfers for guests</p><ul><li>Welcome bags and events}

Honeymoon Destinations

{<strong>For Romance & Relaxation:</strong></p><p><strong>Tulum/Riviera Maya</strong></p><ul><li>Boutique beach hotels</p><ul><li>Cenote swims</p><ul><li>Spa treatments</p><ul><li>Trendy restaurants</p><p><strong>Los Cabos</strong></p><ul><li>Luxury resorts</p><ul><li>Whale watching (winter)</p><ul><li>World-class spa resorts</p><ul><li>Golf and fishing</p><p><strong>For Adventure & Culture:</strong></p><p><strong>Oaxaca</strong></p><ul><li>Food and mezcal</p><ul><li>Day of the Dead (November)</p><ul><li>Monte Albán ruins</p><ul><li>Craft villages</p><p><strong>San Cristóbal de las Casas</strong></p><ul><li>Indigenous culture</p><ul><li>Cloud forests</p><ul><li>Unique experiences</p><ul><li>Off-the-beaten-path</p><p><strong>For Beach Seclusion:</strong></p><p><strong>Holbox Island</strong></p><ul><li>No cars, barefoot luxury</p><ul><li>Bioluminescence</p><ul><li>Whale sharks (summer)</p><ul><li>Ultimate relaxation</p><p><strong>Sayulita/Punta Mita</strong></p><ul><li>Surf town meets luxury</p><ul><li>Pacific sunsets</p><ul><li>Jungle adventures</p><ul><li>Authentic vibes}

Planning Timeline

{<strong>12-18 Months Before:</strong></p><ul><li>Choose destination and venue</p><ul><li>Book venue/resort</p><ul><li>Start guest list</p><ul><li>Hire wedding planner</p><ul><li>Begin legal document process</p><p><strong>9-12 Months Before:</strong></p><ul><li>Book photographer/videographer</p><ul><li>Arrange accommodations for guests</p><ul><li>Plan welcome event and farewell brunch</p><ul><li>Send save-the-dates</p><p><strong>6-9 Months Before:</strong></p><ul><li>Book vendors (florist, music, makeup)</p><ul><li>Order dress (allow time for alterations)</p><ul><li>Plan rehearsal dinner</p><ul><li>Finalize legal documents</p><p><strong>3-6 Months Before:</strong></p><ul><li>Send formal invitations</p><ul><li>Confirm guest RSVPs</p><ul><li>Book honeymoon</p><ul><li>Final vendor confirmations</p><ul><li>Get blood tests appointment</p><p><strong>1 Month Before:</strong></p><ul><li>Final dress fitting</p><ul><li>Confirm all vendor payments</p><ul><li>Create detailed timeline</p><ul><li>Prepare tips and final payments</p><p><strong>Week Of:</strong></p><ul><li>Arrive early for blood tests (if legally marrying)</p><ul><li>Welcome party</p><ul><li>Rehearsal</p><ul><li>Relax and celebrate!}

Guest Experience

{<strong>Making It Easy for Guests:</strong></p><p><strong>Accommodations:</strong></p><ul><li>Room blocks at resort (usually discounted)</p><ul><li>Variety of price points nearby</p><ul><li>Share booking info early</p><ul><li>Consider buyout for intimate feel</p><p><strong>Transportation:</strong></p><ul><li>Group airport transfers</p><ul><li>Shuttle to/from ceremony</p><ul><li>Clear instructions for independent guests</p><ul><li>Welcome bag with local info</p><p><strong>Events Beyond Wedding:</strong></p><ul><li>Welcome party/cocktails (night before)</p><ul><li>Day-after brunch</p><ul><li>Optional group activities (cenote tour, etc.)</p><ul><li>Free time for guests to explore</p><p><strong>Communication:</strong></p><ul><li>Wedding website with all details</p><ul><li>WhatsApp group for updates</p><ul><li>Paper itinerary in welcome bag</p><ul><li>Local emergency contacts</p><p><strong>Cultural Considerations:</strong></p><ul><li>Share Mexican customs (mañanita, etc.)</p><ul><li>Dress code for weather</p><ul><li>Tipping guidance</p><ul><li>Basic Spanish phrases}

Tips from Wedding Planners

{<strong>Insider Advice:</strong></p><p><strong>Do:</strong></p><ul><li>Hire a local wedding planner (worth every peso)</p><ul><li>Visit venue in person before booking if possible</p><ul><li>Have backup plan for weather</p><ul><li>Embrace Mexican touches (mariachi, tequila toast)</p><ul><li>Schedule photos at golden hour</p><ul><li>Stay an extra day to decompress</p><p><strong>Don't:</strong></p><ul><li>Underestimate heat—consider evening ceremony</p><ul><li>Forget sunscreen and bug spray for guests</p><ul><li>Skip the welcome party (sets the tone)</p><ul><li>Over-schedule guests (vacation, not marathon)</p><ul><li>Expect US-style vendor communication (more relaxed)</p><ul><li>Stress about minor details—enjoy the experience</p><p><strong>Weather Wisdom:</strong></p><ul><li>Caribbean: Avoid September-October (hurricane peak)</p><ul><li>Pacific: Avoid June-October (rainy season)</p><ul><li>Best months: November-April almost everywhere</p><ul><li>Always have indoor backup for ceremony</p><p><strong>Money Matters:</strong></p><ul><li>Many vendors prefer cash</p><ul><li>Bring mix of pesos and dollars for tips</p><ul><li>Credit cards work at resorts and major vendors</p><ul><li>Budget 15-20% more than you expect}

Frequently Asked Questions

Is it expensive to have a destination wedding in Mexico?

It can be very affordable. A simple ceremony at an all-inclusive resort can cost $5,000-10,000. Mexico generally costs 30-50% less than comparable US weddings, and your guests get a vacation. Luxury options exist at every price point.

Do I need to get legally married in Mexico?

No. Many couples get legally married at home (quick courthouse ceremony) and then have a symbolic ceremony in Mexico. This avoids the paperwork hassle while giving you the beautiful celebration you want.

What's the best month for a wedding in Mexico?

November through April offers the best weather nearly everywhere. February and March are particularly popular. Avoid September-October on the Caribbean coast (hurricane season) and June-September on the Pacific (rainy season).

How far in advance should I book?

12-18 months for popular venues and dates. 6-9 months is possible but limits options. High season (December-April) and Saturday dates book earliest. Weekday weddings have more availability.

Do I need a wedding planner?

Highly recommended. A local planner knows vendors, navigates language/cultural differences, handles logistics, and ensures legal requirements are met. Resort coordinators handle basics but outside planners offer more customization.
